You may be liable, at the discretion of the Management, to be transferred from one section or department to another or from one place or establishment or branch of the company to another in any part of India or abroad or to any office that may be set up later as may be owned by the Management or may have interest in. Upon such transfer, the rules and regulations of such departments, establishment, or branch whereto you are transferred, as applicable to the staff of your category, shall also apply to you.

Regular office hours are from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. from Monday through Friday, with a break of one hour for lunch and snacks. To cater to the best demands of your role, you may exercise your discretion in planning your week by extending your working hours. Similarly, if the urgency of business or completion of any Project deadlines demand the investment of your extra time and energy, you should be willing to work on Saturdays as well.

div.p: In the event where, at the discretion of the Management, you are assigned to be part of any Global Projects, you shall be required to work closely with the Onsite team to meet the Project deadlines and deliverable milestones, and in such circumstances, the days of working and hours shall be in consonance with the working days and time as may be applicable to the onsite Project team.

If there is any absence from the workplace due to Bandh or Hartal, the same shall be compensated by working on the following Saturday or else such absence shall be treated as Loss of Pay. Saturday and Sunday shall be weekend holidays.

(1) You will be on probation for a period of one month and subject to your performance during this period, the company will either confirm your employment, or extend your probation for a further period prior to confirmation. Probation shall be extended only if the management reasonably believes that your performance expectations could be met within the extended period of probation. During the six months of period, your services may be terminated if found unsatisfactory, on any working day during that period.

(2) Mandatory Performance evaluations will be done upon successful completion of a period of six months and every year a salary revision will be reflected on your pay scale based on your satisfactory performance. Appraisals will be done at the end of each financial year for rewards and compensation. Anybody who joins the company six months prior to the financial year end shall be eligible for such appraisals.

(3) Any Associate who is entitled to receive a promotion and / or increment in recognition of their service excellence as may be rated at their annual Performance Appraisals shall be bound to serve the Company for a period of not less than a minimum of one year following the grant of such increment.

You are entitled to a Casual Leave of eight (08) working days and Sick Leave of four (04) working days in a year based on your date of joining. The approval of earned, casual or any other kind of leave shall depend exclusively upon the urgency and exigencies of work and any such approval shall be granted or withheld at the sole discretion of the Management. For getting such leave or for extension of the leave granted, you shall be required to seek written permission in advance and before commencement/expiry of the leave from the Management through the Reporting Manager in charge, by applying for leave stating the reasons therefore and your address and contact details during such leave period shall also be stated.

The Associate shall apply for any such leave only through the Leave Portal in the HRM System and only the leave as may be approved by the Management shall be deemed as validly granted. If at any time the reasons given for availing such leave are found to be false, you will be liable for dismissal from the services of the company. It is mandatory that Management approval is obtained prior to availing any casual leave. Failure to obtain prior approval through the HRM System for Casual leave and any absence thereto shall be deemed as unauthorized absence and treated as Loss of Pay.All sick leave applications for more than one day shall be submitted along with Medical Certificate issued by an authorized Medical Practitioner. Grant of Compensatory leave (Comp-Off) is at the sole discretion of Management, and it must be pre-approved before any such leave is availed.

You are expected to maintain utmost secrecy with respect to the affairs of the company and shall be bound to maintain the confidentiality of any information, whether written or oral, which relates to the internal businesses or financial affairs, know-how, inventions or any client, agent, contractor, or vendor. You shall not disclose the identity of any of our clients, executives and / or other sensitive information to anyone outside Klystron Technologies. This includes financial and other sensitive information of any of the company’s clients that you may have access to by virtue of your employment with Klystron Technologies. Breach of this provision shall be treated as a gross violation of the terms herein and upon violation, your services shall be liable to be terminated forthwith.

p.strong: 8. Other Rules & Regulations Code of Conduct

div.p: During your employment with Klystron, you are required to follow a code of conduct in keeping with our business requirements and company policies. This includes appropriate dress code, use of proper language (written, verbal and non-verbal), email, telephone / cell phone etiquette and decorum to be always observed in the office and with clients. During office hours, you are expected to devote your whole-hearted time and attention to the business needs of the organization and agree not to pursue or conduct any personal business. The employer expects all Associates to maintain the highest standard of professional conduct throughout their tenure at Klystron.

p.strong: The following amounts to misconduct during employment:

ul.li: Irregular attendance which includes repeated or excessive absence, tardiness or early departure /late coming without approval.
Unreported or unapproved absence (including overstay of leave) for more than five consecutive days or deviation from assigned and accepted schedule for more than five days
Falsification or manipulation of background verification process or employment records, employment information or other records prior to or after joining the Company
Neglect of regular duties and functions.
Practice such as reading personal materials during work time.
Continuous discharge of work function that do not meet the standards reasonably expected
Breach of confidentiality provisions.
Installing, downloading copying, or duplicating any unauthorized or unlicensed software or programs, games, or attachment on any computer system of the employer.
Engaging in illegal activities.
Work-place violence including threats of physical violence.
Causing damage to the property of the employer, of any of Klystron clients or their respective personnel.
Theft of any property belonging to another, the employer or their respective personnel, clients, or visitors.
Corruption, fraud, or misappropriation of funds.
Failure to comply with policies, guidelines, rules, and regulations of the Company.
Excessive personal use of the employer’s telephone, fax, or computer systems.
Any act prejudicial to or in conflict with the interests of the Company or the Employer.

div.p: Your position with the company calls for whole time employment and you will devote yourself exclusively to attend to the business requirements of the company. You will not take up any other work for remuneration (part time or otherwise) or work on an advisory capacity or be interested directly or indirectly (except as a shareholder) in any other trade or business that competes with Klystron directly or indirectly, during your employment with the company, without the prior written permission from the company.
You shall use the company’s resources/assets only for official purposes.

ul.li: a) You shall conduct yourself with utmost decorum and shall efficiently and honestly discharge and perform all duties and functions related to your employment as also such duties as you may be required to perform by the company from time to time, consistent with your employment in relation to the business of the company.

b) Your duty hours shall be fixed by the Management from time to time according to the needs and exigencies of work and these are liable to be changed by the Management from time to time for which you shall have no objection.
c) You shall have no objection to work in any shift, whether day or night, as and when required to do so by the Management.

d) You may be posted from one client to another from time to time as may be required by the needs/exigencies of the company’s business. You may also be expected to serve on the premises of some of our clients. During your presence in the premises of any of our clients, you are expected to be most cordial. Any misbehavior on your part with any of our clients or their Associates shall be considered as gross misconduct on your part leading to severe disciplinary action and/or summary dismissal as may be warranted by the circumstances of the case.

e) If under any circumstances, you have your own reservations to obey any order, it shall be obligatory upon you to first obey that order, and then thereafter represent your grievances to the Management as the case may be. But no representation shall be entertained unless you have first carried out the orders given to you.

f) You shall not refuse to accept any communication delivered to you by hand by or on behalf of the Management. Such refusal on your part shall be considered as misconduct and lead to disciplinary action as may be warranted by the circumstances of the case.
g) Any order or notice pasted on the Notice Board of the company by the Management shall be deemed to have been personally served on you.

h) You shall never go on strike or stage/demonstration without giving 14 (fourteen) days’ advance notice and without placing your grievances, if any, before the Management and without first exhausting all the constitutional means and remedies available to you under the law. In any case, before raising any Industrial Dispute you shall first inform the HR department or person in charge of the HR and attempt to settle such dispute, if any, by mutual negotiations and/or arbitration.

i) When you are accused of any misconduct you are liable to be suspended from service pending enquiry against you. An order of suspension will be communicated to you or pasted on the Notice Board of the Company. During the period of suspension, you shall be paid subsistence allowance as per law. In case the charges are proved against you, you shall be dismissed from the services of the company and such dismissal shall be deemed to have taken effect retrospectively from the date of suspension. But in case you are exonerated from the charges you will be treated as on duty.
j) You should inform the company at once of any act of dishonesty and/or action prejudicial to the interest of the company on the part of any person, which may come to your knowledge.

k) Your service conditions shall be governed by this contract as also by the company’s Standing Orders, Rules and Regulations which are in force for the time being or as may be framed from time to time according to law.

l) You shall work under the supervision and guidance of your superior officers and under the directions of the Management given to you from time to time. You shall work conscientiously and diligently to the entire satisfaction of the Management of the company and to carry out the instructions of your superior or other superior officers in connection with the work allotted or assigned to you from time to time to the best of your skill and ability.

m) You shall be punctual and regular in the attendance of your duties and shall not absent yourself without prior permission of the Management. If you remain absent for any consecutive or continuous period of eight days or overstay for eight days after expiry of the sanctioned leave period, without permission or leave duty granted by the Management, it shall be deemed that you have voluntarily abandoned or resigned your services and accordingly your services shall automatically stand terminated and the lien on your appointment shall be deemed as lost after the expiry of the period of such unauthorized absence or overstay as the case may be.

n) You shall attend to work on close or off-days, and/or work overtime, as and when necessary due to urgency or exigencies of work in the opinion of your team lead or in the opinion of the Management.

o) You shall not, without previous written permission of the Company, carry on any business or enter for any part of your time, in any capacity the services of, or be employed by any other firm, company or person, you shall devote the whole of your time and attention exclusively to your duties to promote the interest and business of the company and shall not utilize or divulge to any other person or persons, firm or company, any of the company’s trade secret, knowledge or confidential affairs.

a) During the period of contract, the company will be at liberty to terminate your employment at any time without assigning any reason whatsoever by giving 30 days written notice in that behalf or by paying a sum equivalent to 30 days salary and upon the expiration of such notice (whether the same will expire at the end of the month of service or at any other time whatsoever) or upon such. payment being made by the company, as the case may be, your employment with the company shall cease forthwith and such termination shall be treated as discharge simpliciter.

b) You shall be at liberty to resign from the employment of the Company by giving 90 days (ninety days) prior written notice in that behalf. In the event of your leaving the employment of the company without giving notice as aforesaid, subject to the discretion of management, you shall be liable to forfeit a sum equivalent to 90 days’ salary, as the case may be, in lieu of such notice. This shall be in addition to other steps or appropriate actions which the Company may be at liberty to take in the best interest of the organization and its clients in whose Projects you may be working at the time of such resignation. Accordingly, where the Associate concerned, who opts to resign, is under any obligation to fulfill any responsibility undertaken to be delivered to any client within a definite timeline, you shall ensure that the notice to quit shall not affect such delivery timelines. In such cases, the acceptance of the notice to quit shall be considered appropriately, without causing any delay to the project delivery timelines agreed with the client.

c) Provided however, you shall, upon opting to leave the employment of the Company before completion of the initial contractual period of two years, desist from engaging in any service similar to the job you have been discharging under the services of the Company for a continuous period of two years with any of the Company’s competitors in the market. If a violation of the non-compete clause specified above is identified or comes to the knowledge of the Company, you shall be liable to pay such amount as may be equal to the undischarged period of the Contract with this Company.

d) If for any reasons beyond the control and power of the Management, it is not possible to provide you with the employment for any specified period, the Management shall be entitled to lay you off for such specified period, or extended period and the provisions of the Industrial Disputes Act in this regard shall be applicable to you.

e) Without prejudice to any of the rights and remedies which the company may have against you, the company will be entitled to terminate your employment forthwith without giving any notice whatsoever or payment in lieu thereof or without any compensation or benefits in case of any act of disobedience, acts subversive of discipline, insubordination, incivility, insobriety, dishonesty, irregular attendance or other serious misconduct or negligence on your part or incompetence in the discharge of your duty, or the breach by you of any of the terms of your employment or if you become bankrupt or are adjudged insolvent or on your compromising with your creditors. For this purpose, the company’s opinion as to whether any of the events mentioned therein has occurred will be final and binding on you and you will not be entitled to question the same on any ground whatsoever.
f) Notice period of 90 days (Ninety Days) will not be valid if this service contract is terminated within the Probation period.
g) Salary of 50% will be withheld during the notice period and the same shall be released on the last working day upon successful completion of all the relieving formalities.
h) In the event of an Associate resigning within 9 months of receiving an increment or promotion, such Increase in compensation from the date of increase shall be deducted from the final settlement.

div.p: All notices under this Agreement will be in writing and will be served by sending the same by registered post in the case of the Company to the Corporate Office of the Company and in your case to your last known address and in proving service thereof it will be sufficient to show that such notice was properly addressed and posted.

ul.li: a) You shall be responsible for the safekeeping and return, in good condition and order, of all the Company’s records and property which may be, or which may come, in your use, custody or charge, or possession. In case of any damage or loss caused to any such record or property etc. due to your negligence, you will be liable to fully indemnify or compensate the Company for such damage or loss suffered as determined by the Management.

b) You shall keep the Company informed in writing within three days of any change in your residential address. Your last address as notified to the company shall be deemed to be the correct one for the purpose of communicating to you by the company.

c) The increment in your salary shall be dependent and based on your actual and regular performance of duty with efficiency, punctuality, discipline and to the satisfaction of the Management. Your increment will be withheld in case your performance of work is found unsatisfactory to the Management.

d) Your promotion (or demotion) shall be decided by the Management, at its discretion, which will depend mainly upon your efficient, regular, and satisfactory attendance and performance of your work and services to the Company, maintenance of discipline and good behavior and your loyalty to the Company.
e) You shall retire from the services of the company automatically without any notice on your attaining the age of 58 years or earlier if you are found medically unfit.

div.p: In addition to the terms and conditions of employment herein above mentioned, you shall also observe, comply with, and be bound by any rules, regulations, and procedures which the company may from time to time separately frame for observance and compliance by its officers and which shall be communicated by the company to you in writing.

The Company shall have the right to add, alter, modify, or abrogate from time to time any term(s) of the contract of employment, including remuneration and perquisites, which shall be communicated to you either by individual letter or by a circular.

This appointment letter is being sent to you in duplicate for your acceptance. Please note that once accepted you are bound by all the above terms and conditions of the contract.

I also acknowledge that Klystron Technologies has the right at any time to access, retrieve, delete, monitor, examine, use and/or disclose my electronic communications and information from me and the content, without notice to me, and that such electronic communications are considered part of Klystron’s business and client records and are not to be considered private or personal to me or any other personnel.
I further acknowledge that the aforesaid right and obligation on my part extends to electronic communications transmitted for either business or personal purpose.

a) I agree that the employer owns all rights, title, and interest in and to all works.

e) I agree to keep and maintain adequate and current records (in the form of notes, sketches, or drawings, and in any other form that may be required by the employer) of all the works developed by me during the period of employment with the employer, which records shall be available and always remain the sole property of the employer.
